blocks.content: Sniffing means capturing data that is moving across a network. In naval style, it is like listening to radio communications between enemy ships without them knowing. Sniffing helps attackers read usernames, passwords, and messages if the network is not secure.

A MITM attack means an attacker places themselves between two communicating systems. In naval terms, it is like an enemy ship secretly positioning itself between two friendly ships and intercepting all messages passing between them.

content: Victims think they are talking directly to each other

blocks.content: ARP poisoning is a technique used to perform MITM attacks. It works by sending fake ARP messages to a network. In naval style, it is like confusing ship radar systems so they think the enemy ship is a friendly one, allowing the attacker to intercept communication.

content: Send fake ARP replies to victims
Used for MITM, sniffing, and session hijacking
